title: Shoyu Chicken Recipe
description: Shoyu chicken is Hawaii's take on teriyaki chicken made with skinless thighs marinated in a sweet, spicy soy sauce, then grilled and served with rice.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Shoyu Chicken 4.7 (1,183) 832 Reviews 156 Photos Shoyu chicken is a popular Hawaiian dish often served with rice. The word shoyu is Japanese for soy sauce. Let the chicken soak in the marinade for at least an hour; the longer the better. Submitted by The Big E Updated on January 19, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 156 156 156 156 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 40 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 cup soy sauce 1 cup brown sugar 1 cup water 1 onion, chopped 4 cloves garlic, minced 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger root 1 tablespoon ground black pepper 1 tablespoon dried oregano 1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes (Optional) 1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper (Optional) 1 teaspoon ground paprika (Optional) 5 pounds skinless chicken thighs Directions Whisk soy sauce, brown sugar, water, onion, garlic, ginger, black pepper, oregano, red pepper flakes, cayenne pepper, and paprika together in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Add chicken thighs and toss to coat evenly. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap; marinate chicken in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Preheat an outdoor grill to medium heat. Lightly oil the grate. Remove chicken thighs from marinade; discard remaining marinade. Grill chicken thighs on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). I Made It Print 2,099 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 338 Calories 13g Fat 22g Carbs 33g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 338 % Daily Value * Total Fat 13g 16% Saturated Fat 4g 18% Cholesterol 114mg 38% Sodium 1304mg 57% Total Carbohydrate 22g 8% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 19g Protein 33g 67% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 47mg 4% Iron 3mg 16% Potassium 346mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Shoyu Chicken 01 of 156 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 156 Photo by  Reebs 12/13/2024 Family favorite Great flavors Crowd-pleaser I have been making this recipe for several years now, with a few small changes according to our likes.I omit the cayenne pepper and red pepper flakes because I do not like the taste. I add in chili powder to the marinade, and use dried ginger powder instead of fresh. I do not measure the minced garlic, I just know I use a lot of it.I double everything in the marinade so I can use a cup or so and thicken it on the stove top for over rice and broccoli when serving the meal.I usually try to let the chicken soak around 18-24 hours.This time we cooked the chicken on our smoker but at a high temp (425°) for about ten minutes on each side. The flavors were phenomenal.My family enjoys this with jasmine rice and broccoli. 03 of 156 Photo by  ReneePaj 03/29/2024 This recipe produced tasty chicken thighs, but I prefer shoyu chicken cooked in the sauce on the stove top. I do think this method would benefit from a longer marinade time (overnight). Make sure you watch them closely on the grill, as the sugar in the marinade will make them burn quickly. 04 of 156 Photo by  Donald Gallauher 06/04/2023 Only thing we do differently is cut WAY back on the cayenne, paprika and red pepper flakes. I like to also put a little of the marinade aside to glaze the chicken at about 160f, and add a pineapple slice. 05 of 156 Photo by  David Howland 04/11/2022 So delicious and different than any other marinated chicken than I’ve made before. I used smoked paprika instead of regular paprika. I also added garlic Chile paste in addition to garlic to add a kick. My wife loved it!!! I made grilled pineapple as the side. So good 06 of 156 Photo by  nicilu22 10/05/2021 07 of 156 Photo by  Osric Currey 09/24/2021 08 of 156 Photo by  Angelina 08/26/2021 09 of 156 Photo by  Theresa 05/09/2021 Hands down, one of the best chicken marinades I’ve ever had. This is now a staple for us. The only thing I did different was used low sodium soy. So delicious! 10 of 156 Photo by  Maybe An Angel 05/07/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Grilled Hawaiian Chicken and Pineapple Sandwiches 91 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings Grilled Hawaiian Chicken 20 Ratings Hawaiian Grilled Chicken 1 Rating Tangy Hawaiian Chicken 26 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken I 207 Ratings Maui Wowie Shrimp 66 Ratings Cedar Planked Salmon 870 Ratings Spicy BBQ Chicken 73 Ratings Jamaican Jerked Chicken 86 Ratings Runaway Bay Jamaican Chicken 43 Ratings Cornell Chicken 85 Ratings Jamaican Jerk Chicken 111 Ratings Grilled Wonton Chicken Salad 31 Ratings Key West Chicken 1,574 Ratings Chef John's Barbecue Chicken 162 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: The Big E
instructions: Whisk soy sauce, brown sugar, water, onion, garlic, ginger, black pepper, oregano, red pepper flakes, cayenne pepper, and paprika together in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Add chicken thighs and toss to coat evenly. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap; marinate chicken in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.;Preheat an outdoor grill to medium heat. Lightly oil the grate.;Remove chicken thighs from marinade; discard remaining marinade.;Grill chicken thighs on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
